remarks: The predicate "is a prime number".  A prime number is an integer greater than or equal to 2 whose only divisor greater than or equal to 2 is itself.  (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 26-Oct-2012.)
statement:
isprm4 $p |- ( P e. Prime <-> ( P e. ( ZZ>= ` 2 ) /\ A. z e. ( ZZ>= ` 2 ) ( z || P -> z = P ) ) ) $.
$d P z $.
